title: Ticket #693: rpmbuild mangling Globus jar files
description:
On rhel5, when rpmbuild builds the rpms for the Condor release, it repacks all of the jar files. It does so in such a way that the gt4 gahp fails on startup in some situations.

Earlier versions of Red Hat don't do this repacking. In later releases of Fedora Core, the jar repacking can be disabled by adding this macro to the rpm .spec file: 

%define __jar_repack %{nil}

To disable the jar repacking on rhel5, the best solution I've found is to redefine the __os_install_post macro. The definition varies by platform, so we'd need to be explicit about where we redefine it. It's a hack, but it works.

We would add the following to the .spec file when building on rhel5: 

%define __os_install_post \
    /usr/lib/rpm/redhat/brp-compress ; \
    %{!?__debug_package:/usr/lib/rpm/redhat/brp-strip %{__strip}} ; \
    /usr/lib/rpm/redhat/brp-strip-static-archive %{__strip} ; \
    /usr/lib/rpm/redhat/brp-strip-comment-note %{__strip} %{__objdump} ; \
    /usr/lib/rpm/brp-python-bytecompile ; \
%{nil}
remarks:
2009-Aug-27 11:27:54 by willb:
Try the following, which should work on RHEL.

%global __jar_repack %{nil}

2009-Aug-27 14:49:46 by jfrey:
The %global line didn't prevent the jar repacking.

Using rpm --showrc on my RHEL 5 machine to see the value of __os_install_post, I see that brp-java-repack-jars is run unconditionally. On a Fedora Core 9 machine, the execution of brp-java-repack-jars is conditional on __jar_repack.

2009-Sep-01 15:27:24 by jfrey:
I met with Will Benton today about this problem. Here is a summary of what we discovered:

The version of rpm and redhat-rpm-config installed on the NMI x86-64 rhel 5 machine (nmi-0251) is almost 3 years old. Will thinks the jar repacking may be better in more recent versions, which are available for rhel 5.

I will build rpm packages on a CSL x86-64 rhel 5 machine with the updated rpm packages and see if the resulting jars suffer the same problem as those produced in NMI.

Interesting observation: jar tvf produces a different listing for the repacked jars.

Original jar contents: 

     0 Thu Oct 14 17:57:34 CDT 2004 META-INF/
   106 Thu Oct 14 17:57:32 CDT 2004 META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
     0 Thu Oct 14 17:57:30 CDT 2004 org/
     0 Thu Oct 14 17:57:34 CDT 2004 org/apache/
     0 Thu Oct 14 17:57:34 CDT 2004 org/apache/naming/
     0 Thu Oct 14 17:57:32 CDT 2004 org/apache/naming/java/
  1253 Thu Oct 14 17:57:30 CDT 2004 org/apache/naming/java/javaURLContextFactory.class
   105 Thu Oct 14 17:57:32 CDT 2004 org/apache/naming/java/package.html
   104 Thu Oct 14 17:57:32 CDT 2004 META-INF/INDEX.LIST

Repacked jar contents:

2009-Sep-01 17:01:27 by jfrey:
I built Condor 7.3.2 rpms on chevre.cs.wisc.edu, an x86-64 rhel 5 machine with newer rpm packages than the NMI build machine. When I use the resulting gt4 jar files on fgt4x4.fnal.gov (one of the Fermi machines where gt4_gahp is dying), gt4_gahp is able to run successfully.

NMI has updated rpm on the x86-64 rhel 5 machines to match that of the x86 rhel 5 machines. As a result, the Globus jar files in the rpms of a Condor build work properly on Steve Timm's machine (fgt4x4.fnal.gov).
